newsitem.title: USA: Sovereign to acquire Bankers Corp.
newsitem.headline: Sovereign to acquire Bankers Corp.

text.p: Sovereign Bancorp Inc and Bankers Corp said Thursday they had agreed to merge in a stock swap valued at $325 million.
Sovereign will exchange $25.50 of its stock for each share of Bankers Corp, they said.
The deal values Bankers Corp stock at 164 percent of book value and 12.5 times the company's earnings of the last 12 months, the bank holding companies said.
The merger is expected to be accretive to Sovereign's 1997 and 1998 earnings and will expand Sovereign's operations in New Jersey, the companies said.

Sovereign and Bankers Corp said the acquisition price will stay at $25.50 per Bankers share if Sovereign's average stock price remains between $11 and $16.50 during a 15-day period prior to the closing of the acquisition.
If Sovereign's average stock price falls below $11 during the pricing period, Bankers Corp shareholders will receive a fixed rate of 2.318 shares of Sovereign for each share, the companies said.
An increase in Sovereign's share price beyond $16.50 in the pricing period would reduce the exchange ratio to 1.545 Sovereign shares for each Bankers Corp share.

Bankers Corp has the right to terminate the deal if Sovereign's average stock price falls below $10.31 and Sovereign's decline in value is 15 percent greater than the percentage decline of a group of similar banking companies, the companies said.
Sovereign's acquisition of Bankers Corp, which has $2.5 million in assets, will make Sovereign the sixth largest bank in New Jersey in terms of deposits.
Sovereign had $9.4 billion in assets as of December 31, 1996.
